decks.notes: This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Rampant Growth and Sphere of the Suns to play powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Inferno Titan. It also includes control elements like Slagstorm and Galvanic Blast to handle opposing threats. Additionally, Kessig Wolf Run can be used to pump up creatures and close out games quickly. The deck uses a combination of strong creatures and removal spells to control the game and overwhelm opponents with powerful attacks.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful creature threats like Primeval Titan and Inferno Titan. It also includes removal spells like Galvanic Blast and Slagstorm to control the board. The combination of ramp, removal, and powerful creatures allows the deck to dominate the battlefield and overwhelm opponents. Additionally, cards like Kessig Wolf Run and Inkmoth Nexus provide alternative win conditions if necessary. The deck aims to establish control early on and maintain it throughout the game to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by ramping up mana quickly with cards like Rampant Growth and Solemn Simulacrum. The key concept is to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Grave Titan and Primeval Titan to dominate the board and apply pressure to the opponent. With removal spells like Doom Blade and Ratchet Bomb, as well as disruptive creatures like Acidic Slime, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game while using Kessig Wolf Run and Inkmoth Nexus to close out games efficiently.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence using creatures with evasion and disruptive effects. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets and Snapcaster Mage, along with the powerful Drogskol Captain, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly while controlling the board with counter spells and removal. Lingering Souls provides additional threats and synergy with Drogskol Captain, and cards like Phantasmal Image and Dungeon Geists offer versatile options for dealing with opposing threats. Overall, the deck seeks to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using Birthing Pod to continuously search for and play powerful creatures from your deck. The deck aims to establish early board presence with mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Avacyn's Pilgrim, and then use Birthing Pod to gradually increase the power and efficiency of your creatures. The deck also includes control elements like Fiend Hunter and Oblivion Ring to handle threats from the opponent. Gavony Township and Sunpetal Grove provide additional value by boosting creatures and providing consistent mana.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly with low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets, Geist of Saint Traft, and Invisible Stalker. It uses spells like Vapor Snag, Mana Leak, and Gut Shot to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for reusing important spells from the graveyard. The deck also utilizes equipment like Sword of War and Peace and Runechanter's Pike to enhance its creatures' power and provide additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence with aggressive creatures such as Champion of the Parish, Delver of Secrets, and Geist of Saint Traft, while using efficient spells like Mana Leak and Vapor Snag to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes utility cards like Snapcaster Mage and Mortarpod for additional value. Overall, the strategy focuses on pressuring the opponent early and maintaining board control to ultimately secure a victory.

This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Drogskol Captain to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Dungeon Geists and Mana Leak to control the board and protect its threats. Phantasmal Image and Snapcaster Mage provide additional versatility and value. Lingering Souls and Moorland Haunt generate token creatures for added pressure. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game through a combination of evasive threats, disruption, and card advantage.

This deck focuses on building up a strong board presence quickly with efficient mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves, Avacyn's Pilgrim, and Birds of Paradise. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Huntmaster of the Fells, Thrun, the Last Troll, and Blade Splicer to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Sword of War and Peace and Garruk Relentless provide additional utility and ways to push damage through. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. The deck utilizes a mix of counterspells like Dissipate and Mana Leak, removal spells like Doom Blade and Tragic Slip, and card draw spells like Think Twice and Forbidden Alchemy. The win condition comes from milling the opponent with cards like Nephalia Drownyard, or by overwhelming them with card advantage from Consecrated Sphinx and Blue Sun's Zenith. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Drogskol Captain, supported by disruption spells and card advantage from Snapcaster Mage. Phantasmal Image can copy powerful creatures on the board, while Dungeon Geists can lock down threats. Lingering Souls provides additional tokens to pressure opponents, while counterspells like Mana Leak protect your own creatures. The deck aims to control the board early while applying pressure to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with small, low-cost creatures and using anthem effects like Honor of the Pure to boost their power. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of weenies, supported by powerful cards like Hero of Bladehold and Mirran Crusader. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Fiend Hunter and Oblivion Ring provide removal options. The deck also includes equipment like Sword of War and Peace to further enhance the combat abilities of the creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly mill creatures into the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting, Mulch, and Tracker's Instincts, and then reanimate them with Unburial Rites. The deck also utilizes ramp creatures like Avacyn's Pilgrim and Birds of Paradise to accelerate into powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Elesh Norn, and Inferno Titan. Lingering Souls provides additional value by creating tokens that can chump block or be sacrificed for reanimation. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats early in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with Illusion creatures like Phantasmal Bear and Lord of the Unreal, utilizing cheap spells like Gut Shot and Vapor Snag to control the opponent's board while pushing damage through. Delver of Secrets provides added pressure with potential for early damage. Geist of Saint Traft provides a powerful evasive threat, while Snapcaster Mage allows for spell recursion and flexibility. Mana Leak and Ponder help maintain tempo and disruption, allowing the deck to maintain control of the board and push for a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with small, efficient creatures in order to deal damage rapidly and efficiently. It includes cards that boost creature power and toughness, as well as those that provide additional creatures to the board. The deck also includes a few removal spells to help deal with any potential threats from the opponent. Overall, the goal is to maintain a steady stream of pressure on the opponent while avoiding being overwhelmed in return.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells and creatures like Acidic Slime and Grave Titan. It also utilizes ramp spells like Rampant Growth to quickly ramp up mana for powerful threats such as Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Curse of Death's Hold and Ratchet Bomb to deal with opposing threats. The key strategy is to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan with removal spells and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with small token creatures and boosting their power with spells like Honor of the Pure and Intangible Virtue. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures, backed up by powerful cards like Lingering Souls and Sorin, Lord of Innistrad. The deck also has a slight lifegain theme with Vault of the Archangel and Elspeth Tirel providing additional value. The inclusion of Sword of War and Peace gives the deck a solid finisher for closing out games.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and ramping mana to cheat powerful creatures into play, all while maintaining card advantage through Faithless Looting and Tracker's Instincts. The key strategy is to fill the graveyard with creatures using Mulch and Tracker's Instincts, then reanimate them with Unburial Rites. The deck includes powerful reanimation targets such as Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite, Wurmcoil Engine, and Inferno Titan. The mana dorks like Avacyn's Pilgrim and Birds of Paradise help accelerate the deck's game plan, ensuring it can quickly bring out its threats and overwhelm the opponent.

The primary focus of this Grixis Control deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through card draw and graveyard recursion. By leveraging cards like Consecrated Sphinx and Liliana of the Veil, along with powerful finishers like Grave Titan and Sorin Markov, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind them out in a long game. With a balance of removal, card advantage, and threat density, Grixis Control aims to outmaneuver and outlast its opponents.

The main focus of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and aggressive plays. The deck includes powerful creatures like Dungrove Elder and Thrun, the Last Troll, supported by mana ramp cards like Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise. Sword of War and Peace helps to push damage through, while cards like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Green Sun's Zenith provide card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to use Birthing Pod to continuously tutor creatures from your deck, allowing you to control the board and outvalue your opponent through powerful creature synergies. By strategically sacrificing creatures and searching for higher-cost creatures, you can quickly assemble a powerful board presence while disrupting your opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes a mix of removal spells and versatile creatures to handle a variety of threats, ensuring that you can adapt to different matchups and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small but powerful white creatures. By utilizing cards that strengthen and protect these creatures, such as Honor of the Pure and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of counterspells like Mana Leak and removal spells like Oblivion Ring help to control the opponent's threats and protect the weenies. This aggressive strategy aims to close out the game swiftly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers to control the board and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Day of Judgment, Doom Blade, and Tragic Slip to deal with threats, along with counterspells like Mana Leak to prevent key spells from resolving, the deck maintains board control. Planeswalkers like Gideon Jura, Sorin, Lord of Innistrad, and Liliana of the Veil provide additional value and win conditions. Lingering Souls provides a steady stream of blockers and threats, while Snapcaster Mage allows for extra value by casting spells from the graveyard.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Snapcaster Mage, paired with powerful burn spells like Incinerate and Brimstone Volley, the deck looks to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes counter spells like Mana Leak to protect its threats, as well as card selection and draw spells like Ponder to ensure a consistent flow of threats and answers. Shrine of Burning Rage provides additional reach and damage potential to close out games.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Geist of Saint Traft, and Phantasmal Image to apply early pressure on the opponent. It also includes control elements such as Mana Leak and Vapor Snag to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Runechanter's Pike and Midnight Haunting allows for additional damage output and token generation. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game efficiently.

This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Geist of Saint Traft. The deck also includes interaction and protection spells like Mana Leak and Vapor Snag to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Runechanter's Pike is used to increase the damage output of the creatures, while cards like Gitaxian Probe and Thought Scour help to dig through the deck for more threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game until victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Geist of Saint Traft, and Porcelain Legionnaire. Use cards like Snapcaster Mage, Gut Shot, and Mana Leak to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your creatures. Lingering Souls provides additional token creatures for offense or defense. Sword of War and Peace provides a powerful equipment option to boost your creatures. Ponder and Thought Scour help you draw into your key cards quickly, while Vapor Snag provides both removal and tempo advantage.

This Azorius Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Drogskol Captain, and Dungeon Geists to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. By including cards like Phantasmal Image and Snapcaster Mage, the deck is able to maintain versatility and adaptability in various situations. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Mana Leak and Vapor Snag to control the board and protect its creatures. With a strong mix of aggressive creatures, support spells, and card advantage engines, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Zombie creatures. It includes cards that provide mana acceleration, removal spells, and powerful Zombie creatures with abilities that synergize well together. The goal is to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent efficiently, leveraging the creatures' abilities and combat tricks to maintain control of the battlefield and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Blade Splicer, Geist of Saint Traft, and Mirran Crusader. These creatures are difficult to deal with due to hexproof or protection abilities. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Angelic Destiny and swords to enhance the creatures' effectiveness in combat. The goal is to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent, utilizing the synergy between creatures and equipment to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to control the board and generate value through creature recursion. By utilizing a variety of mana dorks, powerful creatures, and utility creatures, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by constantly upgrading creatures through the Birthing Pod chain. The inclusion of cards like Sun Titan and Fiend Hunter provide additional value and removal options, while cards like Gavony Township and Batterskull help stabilize against aggressive decks. Overall, the deck aims to grind out opponents through incremental advantage and outvalue them in the late game.

The main concept of this Boros Control deck is to maintain board control through a combination of removal spells, artifacts, and powerful creatures. With cards like Day of Judgment and Oblivion Ring, the deck can clear the opponent's threats while utilizing artifacts like Origin Spellbomb and Glint Hawk Idol to generate card advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through removal and strong creatures until it can establish a dominant position and win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a mixture of counter spells, removal, and card draw while eventually winning with big threats like Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine. Kessig Wolf Run is also utilized to give your creatures a power boost for a lethal attack. With a good balance of ramp, removal, and threats, the goal is to outvalue and outlast your opponent until you can successfully close out the game with your powerful creatures and spells.

The main concept of the deck revolves around overwhelming aggression and fast-paced gameplay with a focus on utilizing powerful creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Thrun, the Last Troll and Huntmaster of the Fells along with mana ramp cards like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves to ensure a steady flow of threats onto the battlefield. The inclusion of Sword of War and Peace adds extra damage potential while cards like Galvanic Blast and Brimstone Volley provide direct damage to the opponent.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing efficient creatures like Hellrider and Strangleroot Geist to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes burn spells like Incinerate and Galvanic Blast to control the board and finish off opponents. Sword of War and Peace provides additional damage and protection, while cards like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves help ramp up mana production. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature aggression and direct damage spells.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to put pressure on the opponent by playing low-cost creatures like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves, while also dealing direct damage with cards like Incinerate and Sword of War and Peace. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Hellrider and Huntmaster of the Fells to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Kessig Wolf Run provides an additional win condition by pumping up the creatures for a lethal attack.

The goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, utilizing mana acceleration from Avacyn's Pilgrim and Birds of Paradise. The deck focuses on playing powerful threats such as Blade Splicer, Hero of Bladehold, Mirran Crusader, and Strangleroot Geist to quickly pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Gavony Township provides a late-game mana sink to pump up the team, while the swords offer protection and additional damage. Garruk Relentless and Gideon Jura provide additional threats and disruption, creating a versatile and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence with small, low-cost creatures that quickly swarm the opponent. The key strategy revolves around utilizing cards that boost the power and toughness of the creatures, such as Honor of the Pure, to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Fiend Hunter and Oblivion Ring for removal, as well as Sword of War and Peace for added versatility and damage output. The overall goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and apply relentless pressure to the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, efficient creatures that can quickly build up a strong board presence. By quickly getting creatures out onto the battlefield and buffing them with cards like Honor of the Pure, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Fiend Hunter provide disruption for the opponent's strategy, while cards like Gather the Townsfolk and Hero of Bladehold can create even more creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Overall, this deck is built to be fast and aggressive.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with small but efficient creatures and using cards like Honor of the Pure to boost their power. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts opponents' plans while cards like Fiend Hunter and Hero of Bladehold provide removal and additional threats. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a continuous stream of creatures while controlling the game with cards like Mana Leak. This aggro strategy aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply constant pressure to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently dealing with threats and generating card advantage, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through attrition. The inclusion of cards like Consecrated Sphinx and Nephalia Drownyard provide additional win conditions and ways to grind out victories in the late game. Overall, the deck seeks to maintain control of the battlefield and resources while patiently waiting for an opening to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of counter spells, removal, and token generation. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources with card draw and powerful planeswalkers. The deck includes a mix of creatures and non-creature spells to maintain flexibility in dealing with various threats. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently removing threats and generating incremental advantage over time. The deck aims to survive the early game and establish dominance in the mid to late game through powerful threats and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Geist of Saint Traft, and Invisible Stalker, supported by counterspells like Mana Leak and disruption spells like Vapor Snag. The key strategy is to maintain control of the battlefield while applying constant pressure on the opponent, using cards like Runechanter's Pike to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, utilizing card draw and utility cards like Ponder and Snapcaster Mage to maintain consistency.

The key idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. By leveraging cards like Delver of Secrets, Geist of Saint Traft, and Lord of the Unreal, along with efficient counterspells like Mana Leak, the deck aims to control the game tempo and pressure the opponent into making mistakes. The inclusion of cards like Phantasmal Image and Snapcaster Mage also allows for versatility and extra card advantage. Overall, the deck is designed to be proactive and apply pressure from the early turns of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively build up a board presence with small, efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish, Delver of Secrets, and Geist of Saint Traft, while using disruptive spells like Mana Leak and Vapor Snag to control the game. The deck also aims to generate value through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Moorland Haunt, while maintaining card advantage with Ponder and Gitaxian Probe. The inclusion of Mortarpod provides additional removal and reach, allowing the deck to quickly close out games.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around zombie creatures. By utilizing powerful aggressive creatures like Phyrexian Obliterator and Geralf's Messenger, along with efficient removal spells like Victim of Night and Tragic Slip, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining board presence. Additionally, equipment like Lashwrithe and Sword of War and Peace can provide additional power and protection to the creatures, enhancing the aggro strategy of the deck.
